p: The mean viral RNA loads (RNA copies [log 10/mL]) at the day of study enrollment (baseline) of all children infected with A/H1N1pdm09 and A/H3N2 virus were comparable, except in the small group of infants infected with A/H3N2 virus ( Figure 1). Children aged 10−13 years (6.3 log 10/mL) infected with influenza B virus had a significantly higher baseline viral load compared with children aged 1−10 years (range, 5.8–6.0 log 10/mL; *.05 > P > .01).
